intro: Habenaria zambesina, commonly known as the Zambesi orchid, is a species of orchid native to tropical Africa. It is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that typically feature a yellow lip and a greenish-blue dorsal sepal. The plant grows as an epiphyte, often found on trees in humid, shaded environments. Its roots are specialized for absorbing moisture and nutrients from the air and surrounding substrate. The botanical features of Habenaria zambesina make it a unique and visually appealing addition to orchid collections.
